Name: Finger ring
Description: Solid cast gold ring with motif on the bezel, in New Kingdom style. This ring bears a depiction of Bes between two images of the hippopotamus-goddess Taweret. Both deities protected mother and child at birth, and are frequently depicted in 18th Dynasty ornament. Each Taweret appears to have speared or to be holding a defeated enemy, on the left side perhaps a desert animal, and on the right a serpent.
